text: [Music]
so when we put together Innovation
there's a lot of chaos and there's a lot
we don't know and we're looking for
guidance in the process that will help
us navigate through the Innovation
process what business models do is they
don't create a checklist but they give
us a process and that process shows us
what what are the things that we need to
do and enables us to actually navigate
in a structured way through the
Innovation process when we talk about
commercial Innovations because there is
so much that is unstructured when we
create an innovative business the
discipline that comes from business
model analysis enables us and guides us
on the structured part so we don't need
to spend too much time and attention on
it if we do it right and we can really
focus on the unstructured creative Parts
which is where a lot of the Innovation
comes
from what we doing the course is start
by identifying what are the key elements
of a business model and I try to do it
at a high level in three parts because
if anything has more than three parts
it's too complex we don't understand it
so step one let's see what are the top
three parts of a business model that are
the value creation model The Profit
model and the logic of the business that
explains why it's going to work what we
then do is perform a detailed analysis
of a company called Dropbox that enables
people to uh share to store and share
data with themselves really between
their different computers and with other
people and we analyze in detail what is
the structure of the business model for
that
company the next a module that we go
into is a module that looks into an
important family of business models
especially in the technology fields
which are business models are based on
network effects and we try to understand
what are some of the difficulties and
what are some of the advantages of
building a network effects based
business model so so in the last module
what we're going to do is take the
different elements we've learned and put
together a business model and present it
in a structured way so that all of us
can practice what we've learned and
hopefully actually build new business
models to think in concrete terms about
success and
failure success is essentially the
result of a large number of failures so
the way we need to think about success
and failure is a how do we fail in a
structured way so that we can turn turn
The failures into a success so think
about each failure is another stepping
stone toward success as opposed to a
failure don't be disappointed as the
question what can I learn from it what
does it mean and what is the next step I
need to take in order to be more
successful
[Music]
